result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Stanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court will consider expungement after 6 months from today's date if Defendant pays off the mandatory costs by then, if not, the Court will consider expungement after one year of today's date.

Defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days. TIME SERVED.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Stanford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: due date amended in CCAP per Order signed on 9/26/2016.
GRANTING the defendant's request to extend the time to pay the fine, costs, and surcharges to October 31, 2016. Signed and filed. Copies conveyed to the defendant and DA's office.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Michael J. Hanrahan, Br. 4, calendar successor, for review. spc
Fild, Letter Asking for Extension of Payment Due Date

Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.    

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days TIME SERVED.  

COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay the mandatory costs and assessments only on or before 09-16-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

COURT will consider expungement after 6 months from today's date if Defendant pays off the mandatory costs by then, if not the Court will consider expungement after one year of today's date.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Morgan Willz supervised by Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a scheduling conference date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Isaiah J Stanford in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
